text: Of everyone watching in the modest, small town theater, n one is more enthralled than 8 year old CARL FREDRICKSEN.
This lighter-than-air craft was designed by Muntz himself, and is longer than 22 Prohibition paddy- wagons placed end to end.
Young Carl stares, mouth agape, wearing leather flight he and goggles -- just like his idol on the silver screen.
And here comes the adventurer now!
NEWSREEL FOOTAGE: the dashing Muntz descends down the gangplank to the delight of the crowd. His dogs trail him
Never apart from his faithful dogs, Muntz conceived the craft for canine comfort! It's a veritable floating palace in the sky...
An opulent dining room.
...complete with doggie bath and mechanical canine walker.
One dog runs suffers through mechanized bath time, while second wears an electrode helmet and runs on a treadmill.
And Jiminy Cricket, do the locals consider Muntz the bee's knees! And how!
Cameras flash as Muntz stands heroic, striking his signat "thumbs up" stance.
"Adventure is out there!"
In the theater, Young Carl returns the thumbs up.
But what has Muntz brought back this time?
Muntz speaks to a crowded auditorium, on stage beside a curtained object.
Gentlemen, I give you: the Monster of Paradise Falls!
He pulls away the drape to reveal a GIANT BIRD SKELETON.
Ooh!
Young Carl leans forward, eyes bulging.
And golly, what a swell monster this is. But what's this?
Skeptical scientists analyze the bones.
Scientists cry foul! The National Explorers Society accuses Muntz of fabricating the skeleton!
No!
Muntz's portrait is removed from a wall of paintings of o famous explorers.
The organization strips Muntz of his membership.
Muntz's "Explorer's Society" badge is ceremoniously RIPPE from his jacket. Carl GASPS. Muntz stands next to his dirigible at an airfield. addresses the crowd.
Humiliated, Muntz vows a return to Paradise Falls and promises to capture the beast... alive!
I promise to capture the beast... alive!
In the theater, young Carl smiles.
And I will not come back until I do!
The crowd CHEERS. Muntz gives his thumbs up from the cockpit as the dirigib lifts off.
And so the    explorer is off to clear his name.     Bon voyage Charles Muntz, and    good luck capturing the Monster of    Paradise Falls!
Carl looks like he just witnessed a miracle.
Young Carl "flies" his blue balloon ("The Spirit of Adventure" hand-written on it) as he runs along the sidew He still wears helmet and goggles.
Here's Charles Muntz piloting his famous dirigible!!
He hurdles Pike's Peak!
Carl jumps over a small rock.
He hurdles the Grand Canyon!
Carl jumps over a crack in the sidewalk.
He hurdles Mount Everest!
Carl jumps over a tree stump... and smacks into it instea
He... goes around Mount Everest! Is there nothing he cannot do?
Yes, as Muntz himself says: "Adventure is--"
"Adventure is out there!"
Carl stops.   Who said that? The voice comes from a dilapidated HOUSE, windows boarded and lawn overgrown with weeds. The weather vane atop the house turns, pulled by ropes.
Look out! Mount Rushmore! Hard to starboard. Must get the Spirit of Adventure over Mount Rushmore...
Carl walks toward the voice.
Hold together old girl. How're my dogs doing? Ruff ruff!
Carl squeezes through the broken door into the foyer.   H follows the voice toward the living room.
All engines ahead full! Let's take her up to 26,000 feet! Rudders eighteen degrees towards the south.

Carl rounds the corner to see... ELLIE, an eight year old girl, her mussy red hair barely visible beneath her flight helmet and goggles. Bare foote her overalls are patched and dirty. The old house has been transformed into a make-believe dirigible cockpit. Ellie steers, the wheel made from a ru old bicycle.
It's a beautiful day, winds out of the east at ten knots. Visibility... unlimited. (yells a command) Enter the weather in the logbook!
The navigator (her hamster) skitters in its cage. Ellie uses two tied-together Coke bottles as binoculars.
Oh! There's something down there! I will bring it back for science. Awwww, it's a puppy!
Carl is distracted by the Muntz newspaper clippings taped the wall.
No time!   A storm! Lightning! Hail!
Ellie pops up in front of Carl.
What are you doing!?!
Carl screams. He lets go of his balloon. It floats throug a broken part of the ceiling and disappears. Ellie circles Carl accusingly.
Don't you know this is an exclusive club? Only explorers get in here. Not just any kid off the street with a helmet and a pair of goggles. Do you think you got what it takes? Well, do you?!?
Carl FUMPHERS.
Alright, you're in. Welcome aboard.
She offers her hand.   Carl looks down, embarrassed.
What's wrong? Can't you talk?
Carl is frozen.   Ellie softens.
Hey, I don't bite.
She takes off her helmet.   Her hair frizzes out in all directions. She removes a homemade GRAPE SODA CAP pin from her shirt pins it on Carl.
You and me, we're in a club now.
Carl smiles.
I saw where your balloon went. Come on, let's go get it!
Carl watches her stride out of the room.   She pops back
My name's Ellie.
She grabs his hand. Carl blushes as she pulls him out of the room.
There it is.
Carl and Ellie look across the attic at the balloon. Betw them the floor has collapsed, save one rickety beam. Carl
Well, go ahead.
She pushes him out onto the beam.
Go on.
Carl steels his courage. He puts on his goggles, starts forward... and FALLS through the floor.
Ambulance.    SIREN blaring.
One lone light on upstairs.
Carl in bed, reading a book by flashlight, his arm in a C Into the room floats Carl's lost BLUE BALLOON. Carl jumps and CALLS OUT in fright.
(re: arm) Ow!
A head pops up from outside the open window.
Hey kid!!
Carl SCREAMS, hitting himself in the face with the cast.
Ow!!
Ellie climbs in the window.
Thought you might need a little cheerin' up. I got somethin' to show ya!
The two hunker under a blanket tent with a flashlight. whispers, as if to protect a National Secret.
I am about to let you see something I have never shown to another human being. Ever. In my life.
Carl's eyes widen in alarm.
You'll have to swear you will not tell anyone.
Carl nods.
Cross your heart. Do it!
Carl crosses.    Ellie unveils...
My Adventure Book!
It's a reused photo album with the words "My Adventure Bo written across it. She opens it to a photo of Charles Mun
You know him.
Carl smiles excitedly.
Charles Muntz, explorer. When I get big, I'm going where he's going: South America.
She turns the page to a map.
It's like America... but south. Wanna know where I'm gonna live?
She turns to an engraving of a large waterfall. A small h drawn picture of Ellie's clubhouse is glued to the top.
(reading caption) "Paradise Falls, a land lost in time." I ripped this right out of a library book.
Carl GASPS in horror.
I'm gonna move my clubhouse there, and park it right next to the falls. Who knows what lives up there? And once I get there...
She flips through her book, revealing a page marked, "STU I'M GOING TO DO." Past that, the pages are blank.
Well, I'm saving these pages for all the adventures I'm gonna have. Only... I just don't know how I'm gonna get to Paradise Falls.
Ellie closes the book, disappointed. Carl has a thought.    He looks at his toy dirigible.
That's it! You can take us there in a blimp! Swear you'll take us. Cross your heart! Cross it! Cross your heart.
Carl does.
Good. You promised. No backing out.
Carl shakes his head "no."
Well, see you tomorrow kid!   Bye.
Ellie hops up and jumps out the window.
"Adventure is out there!!"
She pops back in.
You know, you don't talk very much. I like you.
Carl looks out the window after her in amazement.   He re his head on his balloon.
Wow.
The balloon pops.

FLASH! A photo is taken of the wedding couple: Carl and Ellie, now 19. She jumps at him and gives him a big kiss. Ellie's side of the church erupts like wild frontiersmen. gun shot is fired in the air. Carl's side, rigid puritans in black, clap politely.
Carl carries her past a "SOLD" sign.   It's the same hous where they met as kids.
Still in their wedding clothes: She saws as he hammers.

location: CARL AND ELLIE'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM

text: They push two chairs into place side by side in the livin
Ellie finishes painting "Carl & Ellie" on their MAILBOX. Carl leans in to admire her work but leaves a messy paint handprint on the mailbox! Oh well; Ellie adds her handpri as well. They smile.
Their house now matches Ellie's colorful CLUB HOUSE DRAWI from her childhood Adventure Book.

They run up a hillside together. They lie side by side on a picnic blanket. She describes clouds. He watches as a cloud transforms into a turtle. Carl closes his eyes and smiles.   He's lucky to be with

Ellie emerges from the South America House, dressed in he Zookeeper's uniform. Carl shows off his new BALLOON CART and uniform. Behind h the balloons lift his cart off the ground. Carl jumps to catch it. She giggles.

location: CARL AND ELLIE'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM

text: Carl and Ellie sit side by side in their chairs, reading. Without looking up from their books, they hold hands.

Again at their picnic spot, they watch clouds. Ellie sees elephant with wings. Carl gives it a try and points out a BABY. Ellie lights up, excited. She sees ALL the clouds a babies! Carl is stunned... but smiles.

location: CARL AND ELLIE'S HOUSE, BABY ROOM

text: Ellie finishes painting a wall mural of a stork carrying bundle in its beak. Carl hangs a mobile above the crib.
Carl touches Ellie's shoulder as the doctor explains.   E drops her head in her hands.

Carl joins Ellie.   He hands her the Adventure Book. She

text: Ellie paints a MURAL of their house atop Paradise Falls o the mantle. Carl organizes a compass, map, binoculars, an native bird figurine beneath the painting. It's their shr to Adventure.

text: Carl sets A JAR on a table, "PARADISE FALLS" written on i Ellie drops in a few coins. She looks at Carl and crosses her heart. Carl crosses his.

The jar slowly fills as Carl and Ellie toss in spare chan Their car blows a tire. The two stand by the jar, reluctant.   Carl BREAKS the ja New tire. Carl in the hospital with a broken leg. Breaking jar. A storm rages.   A tree falls, crushing the roof. Breaking jar.

text: Carl struggles to tie his tie.   Ellie helps.   They walk the front door arm in arm.

text: Ellie struggles to tie Carl's tie as they rush out the do A SERIES OF SHOTS as Ellie straightens Carl's ties.    St 1950's ties. Wide 60's ties. Paisley 70's ties.

text: Older Carl and Ellie smile at themselves in the hall mirr
Carl in his 60's. They still work happily side by side at the zoo. Carl's cart lifts off the ground. He casually leans an elbow on it.

location: CARL AND ELLIE'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM

text: Carl and Ellie dance in the evening candlelight. The PARADISE FALLS JAR sits off to the side, now dusty and forgotten.

location: CARL AND ELLIE'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM WINDOW

text: Carl cleans the inside of the window.    Ellie cleans the outside.

Carl vacuums the Adventure Shrine on the mantle. Carl smi at a photo of Ellie as a child, wearing her flight helmet goggles. He looks up at the mural of their house at Parad Falls. His smile fades. Behind him, Ellie sweeps the floor.    Their dream has go unfulfilled. Carl has an idea.
Carl buys two tickets to South America.
Carl hurries excitedly up picnic hill.    He hides the ai tickets in his basket. Behind him, Ellie falters and falls.    She tries to get falls again. Something is wrong. He runs to her.

Ellie lies in a hospital bed.    She looks through her ADVENTURE BOOK. A BLUE BALLOON floats in to the room. Carl stands at the door.   He smiles and walks to her bed Ellie pushes her Adventure Book toward him.    She weakly his cheek and adjusts his tie. He kisses her on the forehead.
Carl sits alone, next to a huge bouquet of balloons.
Carl walks into the house, holding a single blue balloon.

An ALARM CLOCK BUZZES.    An aged hand shuts it off and p up the nearby glasses. CARL sits alone in his double bed.   He rubs his face. GR He gets out of bed, STRETCHING, GRUNTING and CRACKING BON He grabs his cane, with four tennis balls stuck to the bo spokes.
Now dressed, Carl rides his ELDERLY ASSISTANCE CHAIR down staircase. This takes a LONG, LONG time. Three quarters of the way down, the chair stops.    He ba the armrest and the chair restarts.
Carl eats breakfast by himself.
Carl cleans the window with a cloth.    His lonely reflec stares back at him.
Carl dusts the mantle and Shrine to Adventure.
Carl looks in the hall mirror. He puts on his hat and considers his reflection. He straightens his GRAPE SODA P

Many LOCKS are heard unlocking from inside. The door opens, but bangs against the safety chain. GRUMBLES in frustration. Carl opens the door, walks out onto his porch, pulls the shut, and looks as if he's about to go somewhere. He sits in his porch chair.
Carl's house is the lone surviving square on the block no under construction. Machinery and workers circle busily. High rise buildings are being erected all around.
Carl looks at the activity around him.
Quite a sight, huh Ellie? (noticing mailbox) Uhp, mail's here.

Carl walks to the mailbox.    He touches Ellie's faded HANDPRINT and smiles. He looks through the mail. He sees a SHADY OAKS RETIREMENT VILLAGE pamphlet full of images of happy old people. Carl scoffs.
Shady Oaks Retirement.    Oh brother.
Carl notices DUST on his mailbox.
Hm.
He pulls up a LEAF BLOWER.   He revs it and blasts off th TOM, the CONSTRUCTION FOREMAN, notices.
Hey! `Morning, Mr. Fredricksen! Need any help there?
No. Yes. Tell your boss over there that you boys are ruining our house.
He points across the lot to a business man in a suit talk on a cell phone - the REAL ESTATE DEVELOPER.
Well just to let you know, my boss would be happy to take this old place off your hands, and for double his last offer. Whaddya say to that?
The leaf blower blasts off his hat.
Uh, I take that as a no, then.
I believe I made my position to your boss quite clear.
You poured prune juice in his gas tank.
Oh yeah, that was good. Here, let me talk to him.
Tom hands Carl his MEGAPHONE.
(in megaphone) You in the suit. Yes, you.      Take a bath, hippy!
Tom grabs the megaphone.
(to Boss, re Carl) I am not with him! (to Carl) This is serious. He's out to get your house!
Carl walks to his front door.
Tell your boss he can have our house.
Really?
When I'm dead!
Carl SLAMS the door.
I'll take that as a maybe!
Carl sits in his chair watching TV. A KNOCK at the door.

The door opens. A Wilderness Explorer stands, reading from a Wilderness Explorer Manual. He is in uniform, complete with sash, neckerchief, hat, and an enormous backpack stuffed with e piece of equipment there is. This is RUSSELL, age 8. Russell, nose buried in his MANUAL, reads to Carl.
"Good afternoon. My name is Russell. And I am a Wilderness Explorer in Tribe 54, Sweatlodge 12. Are you in need of any assistance today, sir?"
As he finishes the script, Russell smiles up at Carl.
No.
I could help you cross the street.
No.
I could help you cross your yard.
No.
I could help you cross your... porch?
No.
Well, I gotta help you cross something.
Uh, no.   I'm doing fine.
Carl closes the door in Russell's face.
Carl listens through the door. Is the kid gone?   He open
"Good afternoon. My name is Russell."
Uh... kid...
"And I am a Wilderness Explorer in Tribe 54, Sweatlodge 12."
Kid.   KID!!
Russell stops... but goes back to reading.
"Are you in need of any assistance today Sir?"
Thank you, but I don't need any help!
Carl swings the door shut, but a small camping boot stops
Ow.
Carl opens the door.    Russell stands at attention.
(RESIGNED) Proceed.
"Good afternoon. My-"
But skip to the end!
Russell points to his SASH. It is covered with badges exc for one glaringly empty space.
See these? These are my Wilderness Explorer badges. You may notice one is missing. It's my Assisting the Elderly badge. If I get it I will become a Senior Wilderness Explorer!
Russell makes the Explorer Sign: his thumbs form a "W", h fingers the "wings" of a bird, then the "claws" of a bear
"The wilderness must be explored! CAW-CAW! RAAAR!"
This sets Carl's hearing aid off. Carl GRUMBLES in pain.
It's gonna be great! There's a big ceremony, and all the dads come, and they pin on our badges...
So you want to assist an old person?
Yep! Then I will be a Senior Wilderness Explorer!
Carl leans in close to Russell.
(CONSPIRATORIALLY) You ever heard of a snipe?
Snipe?
Bird. Beady eyes. Every night it sneaks in my yard and gobbles my poor azaleas. I'm elderly and infirm. I can't catch it. If only someone could help me...
Me! Me!   I'll do it!
Oh, I don't know, it's awfully crafty. You'd have to clap your hands three times to lure it in.
I'll find it, Mr. Fredricksen!
I think its burrow is two blocks down. If you go past --
Two blocks down! Got it!
Russell runs down the block clapping and calling.
Sniiiipe! Here Snipey Snipey...
(calls after Russell) Bring it back here when you find it!
Carl rolls his eyes and begins to close his door. He stops short. A large truck is backing up, getting dangerously close to ELLIE'S MAILBOX.
Okay, keep her coming... And... stop. Stop! STOP!!
The truck hits Ellie's mailbox, crushing the front.
Carl is shocked.   He runs to the box.
What? Hey! Hey you!         What do you think you're doing?
I am so sorry, sir...
The worker bangs on the mailbox, trying to fix it.
Don't touch that!
No no, let me take care of that for you.
Carl grabs the mailbox, trying to wrestle it from the wor
(STRUGGLING) Get away from our mailbox!
Hey sir, I...
I don't want you to touch it!

Carl HITS the worker with his cane.      He falls to the The worker rubs his head.    Blood. Carl backs up toward his door, cradling his mailbox. has he done? Passerbys stare. Workers gather, as does the REAL ESTATE DEVELOPER. Carl backs into his house.

Carl shuts his door.   He closes the curtains. He peeks out the window. The injured worker is helped to feet. A police car pulls up. The Real Estate Developer looks toward Carl's house. hand rests on Carl's fence.
Carl sits alone on a bench holding a Court Summons.
A GUARD opens the door. Carl enters.    The REAL ESTATE DEVELOPER watches him enter.
A Police Officer drops Carl at his front gate.
Sorry Mr. Fredricksen. You don't seem like a public menace to me. Take this.
She hands him a pamphlet for SHADY OAKS RETIREMENT VILLAG
The guys from Shady Oaks will be by to pick you up in the morning, okay?
The officer drives off, leaving Carl alone. Carl faces the house.    He touches Ellie's dented mailbo
What do I do now, Ellie?
All is quiet but the slow ticking of the clock. The empty hall. The front hall mirror. The kitchen.
Carl pulls out a suitcase.   A book tips over.   Ellie's Adventure Book.
Carl sits in his chair slowly paging through the book.

He turns to the page marked "STUFF I'M GOING TO DO."    H closes the book and sighs. Carl looks at the Adventure Shrine, and the PAINTING of t house by Paradise Falls. He holds the Shady Oaks pamphlet. Carl's brows furrow.    He looks up at the shrine, and cr his heart.
Lights are on inside the house.
A SHADY OAKS RETIREMENT VILLAGE van pulls up. Nurses GEORGE and A.J. walk to Carl's door and KNOCK. Carl answers, holding a suitcase.
Morning gentlemen.
Good morning, Mr. Fredricksen.    You ready to go?
Ready as I'll ever be. Would you do me a favor and take this?
Carl hands over his suitcase.
I'll meet you at the van in just a minute. I... want to say one last goodbye to the old place.
Sure.   Take all the time you need, sir.
Carl closes the door.   Rather sharply.   The nurses head to the van.
Typical. He's probably going to the bathroom for the eightieth time.
Empty helium tanks are strewn on the front lawn.
You'd think he'd take better care of his house.

A SHADOW falls over the nurses.   They turn to look. A giant tarp rises behind Carl's house.     It unfolds to THOUSANDS OF BALLOONS. The balloons rise up like some massive multi-colored cumu cloud forming a thunderhead above the house. Strings tug at the chimney. The house strains.     Pipes then break. Electrical wires spark and snap. The house rips away from its foundation. The nurses duck and YELL as the house soars over them. looks out the window and LAUGHS.
So long boys! I'll send you a postcard from Paradise Falls!
Balloons spill colored light into a little girl's room as house floats past.
The shadow of the house drifts through an intersection.
A family watches the house float down the street.
Carl waves at a high-rise window washer, who tentatively waves back. The house crests the top of a building, drifting over and from the city. Carl looks out his window. Good riddance.
Carl sets a compass next to the map of South America.
Sails made from stitched-together curtains emerge from th windows and billow in the wind. Carl steers using ropes attached to the weather vane.
The compass needle rotates to point SOUTH.
The house turns. Carl looks out the window, satisfied.   He checks the bal
Carl kisses a photo of Ellie.
We're on our way, Ellie.
Carl kneels at the fireplace and plunks the balloon strin tied to the grate. He CHUCKLES and settles into his chair.   He closes his e and smiles. SHADOWS move gently across the fireplace mantle.
The house drifts through the clouds.
Carl relaxes in his chair. KNOCK KNOCK KNOCK.
Huh?
He stares at the front door.   Nothing.
Hm.
He bolts up and approaches the door. He looks out the pee hole. Nothing but the porch and clouds. He throws it open
Nothing. He looks left.     Nothing.   He looks right. He looks... Russell?!!
Hi, Mr. Fredricksen.    It's me, Russell.
What are you doing out here, kid?
Russell is plastered up against the wall, terrified and holding on for dear life.
I found the snipe and I followed it under your porch, but this snipe had a long tail and looked more like a large mouse.
The flag on Russell's backpack blows off and falls throug the clouds.
Please let me in?
No.
Carl slams the door, leaving Russell alone. Beat. The door opens again.
Oh, alright, you can come...
Russell runs into the house past Carl.
Russell PANTS, panicked.   He looks into living room.
Huh. I've never been in a floating house before.
Carl follows Russell into the living room.   Russell chuc and points at the photo of young Ellie.
Goggles.   Look at this stuff!
Russell finds Ellie's house drawing sitting on the pages the open atlas.
Wow, you going on a trip? (reads from the engraving) "Paradise Falls: A Land Lost in Time." You going to South America, Mr. Fredricksen?
Carl takes the page and puts it in his pocket.
Don't touch that.   You'll soil it.
You know, most people take a plane, but you're smart because you'll have all your TV and clocks and stuff.
Russell runs over to the steering rig.
Whoah.   Is this how you steer your house?   Does it really work?
Kid, would you stop with the --
Russell steers and the house tilts, knocking Carl back an forth.
Oh, this makes it go right, and that way's left.
Let go of the -- knock it off!
Russell looks out the window in front of him.
Hey look, buildings!
Russell and Carl arrive at the window.
That building's so close I could almost touch it.
That gives Carl an idea.
Carl lowers Russell on a rope below the floating house.
Wow! This is great! You should try this, Mr. Fredricksen! Look, there's a bus that could take me home two blocks away! (looking up) Hey, I can see your house from here!
(struggling to hold on) Don't jerk around so much, kid!
The rope slips through Carl's hands.   Russell FALLS.
Carl stands beside Russell at the window.    Russell's fa been a daydream.
Well, that's not gonna work.
Carl leaves Russell at the window.
I know that cloud, it's a Cumulo Nimbus. Did you know that the Cumulo Nimbus...
GRUMBLING, Carl kneels at the fireplace to cut a few ball strings with his housekeys.
Stayed up all night blowing up balloons, for what?
...warm air goes by cool air, and the airs go by each other and that's how we get lightning.
That's nice, kid.
Carl turns off his hearing aid.    Silence.   He smiles. Russell tries to get Carl's attention.   A storm is brewi the distance.
(nearly silent) Mr. Fredricksen, there's a big storm coming. It's starting to get scary. We're gonna get blown to bits! We're in big trouble, Mr. Fredricksen!
A huge lightning bolt flash lights up the room.    Carl t on his hearing aid.
What are you doing over there?
Look!
Carl joins Russell at the window.
See?    Cumulo Nimbus.

The tiny house is heading for a MASSIVE STORM. Carl STRUGGLES to steer the house away but is blown into storm. The steering mechanism recoils and sends Carl flyi Plates fall from the walls and furniture slides as the ho is rocked in the storm. Russell's backpack slides toward the front door.
My pack!
Russell HOPS on top of the backpack.
Got ya!

The pack slides toward the OPEN FRONT DOOR. Russell screa He's about to slide out when the house tilts and the door swings shut. The Paradise Falls jar rolls past Carl.     He chases aft Ellie's chair slides across the room.      Carl gasps and protect it. The photo of Ellie rocks and slides off the wall.     Car lunges to catch it.
The storm rages.    The house is tossed into the storm cl All goes black.
Carl is asleep. A finger pokes Carl's face.     Nothing. The finger pokes Carl's face again.    Carl WAKES UP.
Whew!    I thought you were dead.
Wha... what happened?
Carl STRUGGLES to rise from the pile of Ellie's things he been protecting.
I steered us. I did!      I steered the house!
Steered us?
After you tied your stuff down you took a nap, so I went ahead and steered us down here.
Carl opens the window and looks out.
Huh?
The house floats motionless above an ocean of clouds.
Can't tell where we are.
Oh we're in South America all right. It was a cinch, with my Wilderness Explorer GPS.
Russell holds up his WILDERNESS EXPLORER GPS UNIT.
GP-what?
My dad gave it to me. It shows exactly where we are on the planet. With this baby, we'll never be lost!
Russell gestures, tossing the unit out the window.
Carl and Russell watch the tiny GPS unit descend into the clouds.
Oops.
Carl kneels by the fireplace and cuts at the balloon stri
We'll get you down, find a bus stop. You just tell the man you want to go back to your mother.
Sure, but I don't think they have busses in Paradise Falls.
A small cluster of balloons fly up and away from the hous
There. That ought to do it. Here, I'll give you some change for bus fare.
Russell follows Carl toward the front door.
Nah, I'll just use my city bus pass.
The house lowers into the fog.
Whoah, that's gonna be like a billion transfers to get back to my house.
Carl and Russell stand on the porch as the house moves do into and through the thick, dark clouds.
Mr. Fredricksen, how much longer?
Well, we're up pretty high.   Could take hours to get down.
Something flashes by them in the fog.   Carl leans forwar
...that thing was...building or something.
Another dark object whooshes past them.   Carl ducks.
What was that, Mr. Fredricksen?
We can't be close to the ground yet.
A brief view of rocks directly below them. Carl GASPS.
BAM!!!   The house CRASHES into the ground. Russell and Carl fly off the porch and onto the ground. land hard. Carl's house is floating away! Carl runs after the GARDEN HOSE dragging across the groun
Wait, wait! No don't, don't, don't!
Carl grabs the hose and is PULLED UP in the air.
Whoah!   Hey, hey!
Russell JUMPS onto Carl's leg and the extra weight pulls to the ground.
Russell, hang on!
Carl and Russell slide toward the edge of a CLIFF EDGE.
Whoah!
They slide toward the edge... and stop.   The drop is thousands of feet. Carl is TERRIFIED.
Walk back!     Walk back!
Okay!
Russell PULLS Carl by the leg away from the cliff edge. Carl, still hanging from the hose, looks around. Fog blankets the mysterious landscape, revealing only scattered rocks.
(out of breath) Where... where are we?
